Class Board

java.lang.Object
XXLChess.GameObject
XXLChess.Board
public class Board extends GameObject
Represents a board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(String[][] levelArr, processing.core.PApplet app)
      Constructor for creating a new board.
      Parameters:
      levelArr - is a matrix containing the code of piece in a matrix extracted from the config file.
      app - is the applicaiton we are running on.

  • Method Details

    • setSpriteAndDisplay

      public void setSpriteAndDisplay(processing.core.PApplet app)
      Set image for all pieces and draw them.
      Parameters:
      app - is our main application.

    • startClick

      public int startClick(int x, int y)
      Process information of the clicks when there is no selected pieces.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate of the click.
      y - is the y coordinate of the click.
      Returns:
      1 when successully selected a piece, 0 otherwise.

    • selectClick

      public int selectClick(int x, int y)
      Process information of the clicks when there is a selected pieces.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate of the click.
      y - is the y coordinate of the click.
      Returns:
      0 when reseting the selected piece, 2 if succesfully move a piece, 3 if make a legal move that not protect the king when it is in check

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(Move move, boolean display, boolean submove)
      Make a move.
      Parameters:
      move - is the move to execute.
      display - is the flag indicating whether the change to the board will display or not(not display is for AI computing moves).
      submove - indicates whether the move is the submove.

    • getAllMoves

      public List<Move> getAllMoves(boolean isWhite, boolean order)
      Get the all legal moves from one side.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - indicates whether the move is from white side or black side.
      order - indicates whether we have the move in order of the move score(for AI alpha beta pruning purpose).
      Returns:
      a list of all legal moves satisfying the parameters.

    • checkCheck

      public boolean checkCheck()
      Check if the current king of one side is being check.
      Returns:
      true if the current king is being check or false otherwise.

    • checkCheckMate

      public boolean checkCheckMate()

    • checkOnWay

      public static boolean checkOnWay(Square start, Square end, Square check)
      Check if one square is on the same line with other squares.
      Parameters:
      start - is the starting square.
      end - is the ending square.
      check - is the square being checked if it is on the same line with start square and end square.
      Returns:
      true if 3 squares in on the same line, false otherwise.

    • displayCheckMatePiece

      public void displayCheckMatePiece()
      After a checkmate, this function is called to display all the pieces contributed to the checkmate.

    • resetSquares

      public void resetSquares(Square prevSquare, Square target)
      Function to reset the color of the square and all the atributes related to the current state of the board.
      Parameters:
      prevSquare - is the move selected previously.
      target - is the square(if not null) that the piece will move to.

    • pieceAttackSquare

      public Piece pieceAttackSquare(boolean isWhite, Square target)
      Get the piece which attacks a particular square.
      Parameters:
      isWhite - is the side of piece attacking.
      target - is the square we wish to get the piece attacking this square.
      Returns:
      the piece which attacks this square, or null if otherwise.

    • forceKingToEdge

      public double forceKingToEdge()
      Function to return values for the evaluate function that encourage AI to make the opponent king to edge for easier checkmate.
      Returns:
      values for the evaluate function.

    • evaluateBoard

      public double evaluateBoard()
      Evaluates the current state of the board by various factors: position of pieces, position of kings, pieces value.
      Returns:
      the evaluted score of the current state of the board, negative if black has an advantage, positive if white has an advantage, 0 if black and white are equal.

    • evaluateCapture

      public double evaluateCapture(Move move, double alpha, double beta, boolean maximize)
      Function called after evaluateMove to go to the end of the capture chain to get the best optimized values out of if. This function has no depth since we will go to the end of the capture chain.
      Parameters:
      move - is the move to make.
      alpha - is the maximun values founded so far.
      beta - is the minimun values founded so far.
      maximize - is the flag indicating whether we are maximizing the values of move or not(white need to maximize while black need to minimize).
      Returns:
      value of the move.

    • evaluateMove

      public double evaluateMove(Move move, int depth, double alpha, double beta, boolean maximize)
      An evaluation function that evaluates a move by using minimax algorithm combining with alpha beta prunning.
      Parameters:
      move - is the move to make.
      depth - is the number of moves afterwards we want to consider to evaluate the current move.
      alpha - is the maximun values founded so far.
      beta - is the minimun values founded so far.
      maximize - is the flag indicating whether we are maximizing the values of move or not(white need to maximize while black need to minimize).
      Returns:
      value of the move.

    • unmove

      public void unmove(Move move, boolean isMoved, boolean submove)
      Reset the state before a move is executed.
      Parameters:
      move - is the move had been executed.
      isMoved - is whether the moving piece is previously moved or not.
      submove - is the flag indicating whether the move has the submove or not.

    • newMoveSet

      public void newMoveSet()
      Updates the moveset of all pieces and reset state of squares.
